Articles.Content:
First, I have no idea if anyone knows about this already, so forgive me if this is a known feature. I've never seen or heard of it before.

I decided I'd check the Astronaut complex, seeing as I just sent something to Duna and followed it the whole way there. I clicked slightly elsewhere of where I normally would, and guess what (check the bottom left of the first screenie...):

Umm...

HOLY MOTHER OF--

I literally (and I mean literally) squawked when I saw this. Now that was some epic mis-clicking. Like I say, I don't know if this is known already, but... oh my.
Oh wow. So this means its possible to change our main flag? Wicked
This is a known feature IIRC prior to the addition of the astronaut complex/R&D facility, the flagpole was more prominent.
Yeah it's there since the Flags update been around, you can change flags whenever you want.
Yep, been there since .20... (aka since flags were added)
I discovered this a while ago, but I keep forgetting it's there.

I know about that feature but I only found it by accident, same as OP. It sure is no secret but since the flagpole is so tiny it's usually not obvious it is possible to click on it.

It would probably help if the whole grass field around the flag was clickable for the same function.

By the way the flag next to launchpad is also "selectable" but clicking on it does nothing.
I found something similar a few weeks ago: the KSC Monolith is visible in the Space Center screen. It's the tiny speck way in the distance - barely visible, but definitely real.
So uhmm... this is news to me! Cool.
It's been there for a very long time, Just has been getting progressively smaller with every update.
Today I Learned! Super-handy for the invariable times when I want a new save but haven't loaded a flag into the KSP directory yet.
Thank you, for reminding me of this feature.
I was like you too. I was like "What? What is this? I never saw it before! Omg! Hidden feature!" o:
So far I've been updating my flag in the save-file directly, but of course that's what you HAVE to do, if you want to back-fill all your planted flags with the same design.

OMG! YES!

Now I can display my wonderful flag at KSC! (I have a mod that adds flag parts, as well, but they tend to have major clipping issues)

I found something similar a few weeks ago: the KSC Monolith is visible in the Space Center screen. It's the tiny speck way in the distance - barely visible, but definitely real.
This stands to reason, since the Space Center screen shows the "real" view (though it doesn't load ships), rather than being a pre-rendered image. You can move the camera about in the space centre screen.
Where do you have to click? In the old space center view, you could just click on the flag pole.

I think you can also change them in the VAB under "change mission flags"

JK

I think you can also change them in the VAB under "change mission flags"

JK

That changes it only for the current mission.

We need real loading hints to point this sort of stuff out. Things like double clicking on windows lets you look around and zoom in in IVA. It impossible to descover some things in KSP except by accident.
